Generate_script_prompt:
Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing as an example.
        Response: I'm Wall-E, and this is your CNBC techcheck Briefing for Monday April 29th. Tesla is asking shareholders to reinstate CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package, which a Delaware judge voided earlier this year. The judge ruled that the record-setting compensation deal was, quote, deeply flawed. Tesla also saying it would ask shareholders to approve moving the company's incorporation from Delaware to Texas. The company has hired a proxy solicitor and plans to spend millions of dollars to help secure votes for the two proposals. Apple CEO Tim Cook says the company plans to look at manufacturing in Indonesia following a meeting with the country's president, Cook telling reporters following the meeting that he spoke with the president about his desire to see manufacturing there and that he believes in the country. The comments come as Apple is pushed to diversify its supply chain with more manufacturing outside of China in countries such as Vietnam and India. Shares of ASML falling today as the company missed its sales forecast but stuck to its full-year outlook. Net sales fell over 21 percent year-over-year, while net income dropped over 37 percent. ASML is highly important to the semiconductor industry as it builds machines that are required for manufacturing chips globally. Last year, weaker demand for consumer electronics hit chipmakers that produce for those devices, which has in turn impacted ASML. That's all for today. We'll see you back here tomorrow.
        Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing using the following news titles and content. Use the same beginning and ending(including mentioning host Wall-E and Thursday February 13), and replace CNBC techcheck briefing to 'AI briefing' 
 ""

Response:
Script: i'm wall-e, and this is your ai briefing for thursday, february 13th. microsoft is ramping up its investment in the ai space with an additional $10 billion commitment to openai, the company behind the popular chatbot, chatgpt. this move follows on the heels of microsoft's initial investment and signals its continued focus on leveraging ai technologies to enhance its software offerings across office and azure. meanwhile, amazon is unveiling a new line of smart home devices that integrate seamlessly with its virtual assistant, alexa. these include a cutting-edge thermostat and updated echo devices designed to improve home automation capabilities. the announcements come as amazon looks to strengthen its position in the smart home market and fend off competition from google and apple. on the cybersecurity front, crowdstrike reports that it has identified a new strain of ransomware targeting government and financial institutions globally. the cybersecurity giant emphasizes the need for heightened vigilance and robust security measures to combat this growing threat. that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Polished Script:
"i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for thursday, february 13th. microsoft is making waves in the ai sector, announcing an impressive $10 billion investment in openai, the innovative company behind the popular chatbot, chatgpt. this follows microsoft's initial funding and underscores its commitment to integrating ai technologies into its office suite and azure cloud services.

switching gears to amazon, the tech giant is set to launch a new range of smart home devices that seamlessly work with its virtual assistant, alexa. this lineup features an advanced thermostat and updated echo devices, enhancing home automation capabilities. amazon's move aims to solidify its standing in the smart home market, as it faces fierce competition from google and apple.

on the cybersecurity front, crowdstrike has identified a concerning new strain of ransomware targeting government and financial institutions worldwide. the cybersecurity leader stresses the importance of heightened vigilance and robust security measures to tackle this escalating threat.

that's all for today's tech briefing. join us tomorrow for more updates."
Podcast Title: EP-216 Microsoft's $10b Ai Bet with Openai 💰, Amazon's Smart Home Expansion 🏡, Ransomware Alert by Crowdstrike 🔒
Podcast Description:
i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for thursday, february 13th. explore the latest developments in the tech world:

  • microsoft's $10 billion investment in openai: expanding its commitment to ai integration across office and azure services, bolstering the capabilities of the chatgpt chatbot.
  • amazon's new smart home devices: unveiling an advanced thermostat and updated echo devices to enhance home automation and competitiveness against google and apple.
  • cybersecurity alert: crowdstrike highlights a new ransomware strain targeting government and financial institutions, calling for increased security measures.

join us tomorrow for more tech insights!
Image Prompt: a cohesive podcast cover image showcasing a futuristic cityscape at twilight, where technology intertwines with everyday life. in the foreground, a sleek, autonomous drone hovers, its screen displaying an ai neural network pattern, symbolizing microsoft's $10 billion ai investment with openai. interwoven with this, the skyline is dotted with smart homes, each emitting a soft, warm glow, representing amazon's ongoing expansion into the smart home market. in the sky above, a digital lock symbol is projected, casting a protective shadow over the city, indicating crowdstrike's alert on ransomware threats. together, these elements form a unified vision of a technologically advanced, interconnected society safeguarded against emerging cyber threats
